messageBody:
On Fri, 13 Jul 2001 11:31:20 +0200, Wolfgang Egger <beuys@...>
wrote:

||| Servus,
|||
||| I have to test a distributed "WebDriven" application. Therefor I use
||| JUnit in conjuntion with HttpUnit. Until now I run the tests with the
||| junit.textui.TestRunner within an endless loop.
|||
||| As a next step I want every programmer being able to see the
||| testResults, so that they can see what they produce, even if the don't
||| code their own UnitTests:-)

Do you need for every programmer to actually run the tests, or do they
just need to see the results? If all they need is the results, you could
run your tests under Ant, and then use the optional junitreport task. It
generates really nice looking reports based on the output of the
also-optional junit task. It's kind of tricky to get setup initially, but I
did it last week and am quite pleased with the results.
